titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by M. Wendy Hennequin

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-09-06T09:20-0400

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Cyndy Szekeres has illustrated over 40 children's books, and is best known for her animal characters.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Cyndy Szekeres (pronounced "zeck-er-es") was born 31 October 1933, the daughter of a toolmaker, Stephen Szekeres, and his wife Anna Ceplousky Szekeres. In 1954, Szekeres earned a certificate from the Pratt Institute in New York. Szekeres has illustrated over 40 children's books, and is best known for her animal characters. She has also written or compiled and self-illustrated 67 titles. Szekeres won the AIGA Award for her work on Moon Mouse (1969). Szekeres currently lives on a farm in Vermont.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Cyndy Szekeres Papers consist mainly of correspondence, artwork, and publishing materials for over two dozen Cyndy Szekeres titles, dating from 1961 to the 1980s. The collection also includes pieces from later dates. The collection includes both preliminary and finished artwork, dummies, separations, and proofs, as well as typescripts for select titles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection contains a single series, arranged alphabetically by book title. Materials are boxed together according to size, but listed in the finding aid according to title.
Series I: children's Literature ( undated, 1961-2004) is arranged alphabetically by title.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Cyndy Szekeres Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection has been donated by the artist in installments beginning in 1991.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of children's literature and artwork. Several of these collections, such as the Richard Scarry Papers, the Ruth Krauss Papers, the Leonard Everett Fisher Papers, and the Joseph A. Smith Papers, present the work of children's authors/illustrators active during the same periods as Szekeres. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.
